definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)

sentences.english: Gravity acts on the large mass of the collars to provide the downward force needed for the bits to efficiently break rock.
sentences.chinese: 鑽鋌的重量提供了鑽頭有效破碎岩石所需要的向下力。

sentences.english: As such, magnetic particle inspection for the screw thread of the drill collar is very necessary and important.
sentences.chinese: 因而鑽鋌內外螺紋的磁粉檢測十分必要和重要。

sentences.english: The drill collars must be made of nonmagnetic material.
sentences.chinese: 鑽鋌必須是由非磁性物質做成的。

sentences.english: Have you measured those spiral collars and flex joints?
sentences.chinese: 你量過那些螺旋鑽鋌和撓性短接嗎？

sentences.english: We need a short drill collar.
Never reverse rotary table into the DC or any tubular when making up connections.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要反轉轉盤爲鑽鋌和管子上扣。

sentences.english: Connect the feeling plate to the drill collars .
They have not measured the length of spiral drill collars and monel collars yet.
sentences.chinese: 他們還沒測量螺旋鑽鋌和無磁鑽鋌的長度。

sentences.english: Wang collar, large calendar for cotton prefectural governor, write a poem.
sentences.chinese: 王鋌，大曆中爲綿州刺史，詩一首。
見其伸頸俯仰，吐出黃金半鋌。

sentences.english: The failure of collar connection thread is one of the prime drill tool failures.
sentences.chinese: 石油鑽鋌螺紋聯接失效是鑽具失效的主要類型。

sentences.english: Do not leave pipe or collars that are not in use standing in mast or derrick.
sentences.chinese: 不許在井架上排放用不着的鑽桿和鑽鋌。

definition: a long narrow vessel with two masts
operculum (Latin: little lid)/a covering flap (in various branches of anatomy)
